alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 10:29PM EDT until July 15 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1026 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a weakening line of showers and thunderstorms moving across the Charleston Peninsula. High tide as passed, however drainage systems likely remain flooded with sea water. Any rainfall will lead to minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas, mainly in Downtown Charleston and for areas adjacent to the Charleston Harbor. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Downtown Charleston, Fort Sumter, James Island, Daniel Island, West Ashley, Sullivan`s Island, Fort Johnson, Sullivans Island, Patriots Point, Marion Square, Columbus Street Terminal, Ravenel Bridge, Mount Pleasant Waterfront Park, Medical University Of South Carolina, Remleys Point, The Old Village, Stiles Point and Hobcaw Point.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Charleston will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
